item.title: Emily add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "All truly great thoughts are conceived while walking." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Emily add a quote by Shneur Zalman
item.description: "Words are the pen of the heart, but music is the pen of the soul." -- Shneur Zalman

item.title: Emily add a quote by Edmond Rostand
item.description: "All our souls are written in our eyes." -- Edmond Rostand

item.title: Emily add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "But it isn't easy,' said Pooh. 'Because Poetry and Hums aren't things which you get, they're things which get you. And all you can do is to go where they can find you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Emily add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "Deep thinking is attainable only by a man of deep feeling, and all truth is a species of revelation" -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Emily add a quote by Ingrid Bergman
item.description: "A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous." -- Ingrid Bergman

item.title: Emily add a quote by Friedrich von Schiller
item.description: "I feel an army in my fist." -- Friedrich von Schiller

item.title: Emily add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "I never know what I think about something until I read what I've written on it." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Emily add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "When my horse is running good, I don't stop to give him sugar." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Emily add a quote by Halford John Mackinder
item.description: "Knowledge is one. Its division into subjects is a concession to human weakness." -- Halford John Mackinder

item.title: Emily add a quote by Jean Piaget
item.description: "I could not think without writing." -- Jean Piaget

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Aquinas
item.description: "There would not be a perfect likeness of God in the universe if all things were of one grade of being." -- Thomas Aquinas

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Gunn
item.description: "One is always nearer by not keeping still." -- Thomas Gunn

item.title: Emily add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Emily add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "All things are manifestations of one thing only." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Emily add a quote by Christopher Wren
item.description: "Neither need we fear to diminish a miracle by explaining it." -- Christopher Wren

item.title: Emily add a quote by Sir Isaac Newton
item.description: "A man may imagine things that are false, but he can only understand things that are true." -- Sir Isaac Newton

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Emily add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Emily add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I was not so old that I would deny my own senses." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Emily add a quote by Lisa Genova
item.description: "The well-being of a neuron depends on its ability to communicate with other neurons. Studies have shown that electrical and chemical stimulation from both a neuron's inputs and its targets support vital cellular processes. Neurons unable to connect effectively with other neurons atrophy. Useless, an abandoned neuron will die. " -- Lisa Genova

item.title: Emily add a quote by Derrick Jensen
item.description: "a real partnership in which all parties help all others to be more fully themselves" -- Derrick Jensen

item.title: Emily add a quote by Derrick Jensen
item.description: "Yes, it's vital to make lifestyle choices to mitigate damage caused by being a member of industrialized civilization, but to assign primary responsibility to oneself, and to focus primarily on making oneself better, is an immense copout, an abrogation of responsibility." -- Derrick Jensen

item.title: Emily add a quote by Derrick Jensen
item.description: "We cannot hope to create a sustainable culture with any but sustainable souls." -- Derrick Jensen

item.title: Emily add a quote by Derrick Jensen
item.description: "The global industrial economy is the engine for massive environmental degradation and massive human (and nonhuman) impoverishment." -- Derrick Jensen

item.title: Emily add a quote by Baruch Spinoza
item.description: "The greatest secret of monarchic rule...is to keep men deceived and to cloak in the specious name of religion the fear by which they must be checked, so that they will fight for slavery as they would for salvation, and will think it not shameful, but a most honorable achievement, to give their life and blood that one man may have a ground for boasting." -- Baruch Spinoza

item.title: Emily add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "[D]on't ever apologize to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologize to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read... " -- Neil Gaiman
